intro: Senecio perplexeus, commonly known as the perplexing groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio perplexeus is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
